channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI is suffering an exodus of senior talent
item.description: The newest departures leave OpenAI with only three of its 11 original cofounders.

item.title: Big Tech stocks got clobbered on Monday. What investors are looking for before they buy more
item.description: A sharp sell-off in 2024's winning names has left investors wondering whether it is safe to scoop up technology shares.

item.title: American women are crushing it. Why aren’t they getting paid what they’re worth?
5 ways a Harris-Walz win could reshape U.S. health care
item.description: Big changes could be coming, according to policy experts.

item.title: Markets are counting on the Fed to head off recession with sizeable interest rate cuts
item.description: How Chair Jerome Powell and his cohorts react likely will go a long way in determining how investors negotiate a turbulent climate.

item.title: The Treasury-market scandal hiding in plain sight
An interest rate cut won’t fix the housing crisis, Moody’s economist says
item.description: Rate cuts will help, but there’s still a shortfall of close to 2 million homes in the country, according to Moody’s.

item.title: Disney raises streaming prices for Hulu, Disney+ and ESPN+
item.description: Starting mid-October, most plans for Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+ will cost $1 to $2 more per month.

item.title: Elon Musk’s X sues advertisers over alleged ‘boycott’ after Twitter takeover
In Tim Walz, Kamala Harris gets a labor champion who can still appeal to critical heartland voters
item.description: The Minnesota governor has passed sweeping labor reform laws in his second term, earning the endorsements of UAW President Shawn Fein and Senator Bernie Sanders.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Kenvue, Caterpillar, Uber, CrowdStrike and more
item.description: Names on the move ahead of the open.

item.title: Why fiber company Lumen’s stock is extending its surge with an 80% pop
How an obscure Japanese yen trade sparked a global market meltdown—and why the worst could be yet to come
item.description: Financial experts explain the Japanese yen carry trade, a Wall Street favorite that’s beginning to unwind.

item.title: Microsoft fires back at Delta after massive outage, says airline declined 'repeated' offers for help
item.description: Microsoft said Delta turned down several offers for help during the flight disruptions following the outage.

item.title: How to locate the best values in the wake of a stock-market wipeout
